revised_title: Investigations of Alkali Metals in Hydrogen Flame Gases: Thermal and Chemiluminescent Effects of Free Radicals
tldr: The authors studied the effects of alkali metals in hydrogen flame gases, focusing on the thermal and chemiluminescent effects produced by free radicals. They observed a rapid rise in intensity at the reaction zone followed by a steady increase in flame temperature. The results were used to estimate the concentration of free radicals and provide insights into the velocity constants of ternary reactions.
